page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO SOUTH LINCS
page.content: In this unspoilt area the land cover is arable with some permanent grassland and mixed woodland. There is a variety of birds, butterflies, wild flowers and animals. The district, which is very sparsely populated, includes the small hamlet of Lound, part of the hamlet of Scottlethorpe and a few farms. Two main roads, the A151 Bourne - Colsterworth and A6121 Bourne - Stamford run through the area,with an infrequent bus service on each. The land rises gently to the west of the small market town of Bourne, not too distant from the Lincolnshire fens. Recreational facilities are confined to horseriding, nature trails,walking, shooting and birdwatching.
